title: IoT Developer iOS
description:
### **Job Description**


We are looking for an experienced iOS Developer to join our customer in Stockholm and take responsibility for contributing to the development of the new IoT Mobile App. Responsibilities will be from writing clean and sophisticated code, developing custom UI widgets and complex layouts with advanced UX, Dealing with complex modular projects, interacting with cloud infrastructure and working with a global team spread across different locations worldwide will be yours the day-to-day business.  

You will be working in contact with many parties that are involved in the development of connectable products such as Digital Products, IT, R&D, Marketing and Design. Problem solving, cooperating with coworkers with different backgrounds, point of views and various cultures will be essential.

**Tasks:**

* You will be involved in all aspects of developing new features including user story elaboration, estimation, analysis, design, programming, unit/integration testing and debugging following Agile development practices
* Build industry leading mobile apps for connected appliances on a global scale
* Elaborate, estimate, and design for small increments of work just-in-time
* Commit to completing well-defined work and deliver on those commitments
* Perform technology evaluation and design spikes

### **Qualifications**

* Strong skills in SwiftUI, Swift, UIKit or similar programming languages
* Ability to write automation tests
* Familiarity with MVVM, REDUX design patters, SOLID principles
* Understanding in Combine, Async/Await technologies

### **Company Descripiton**


Our client is a global leading company that manufactures household appliances to make households easier. If you want to be involved in influencing tomorrow's household appliances, then this is the client for you!

### **About JobBusters**


JobBusters is an authorized staffing and recruitment company targeting white-collar workers and was started in 2011. We at JobBusters care about our consultants and our goal is always to build long-term relationships with both consultants and clients. Our goal is always to match our clients' dream candidates with our candidates' dream jobs!

### **When you join JobBusters**


As a consultant at JobBusters, you can feel secure with a collective agreement, available consultant managers and committed recruiters. As a consultant, you also get access to our network of exciting companies and clients! For us, it is important that you as a consultant feel comfortable, feel a sense of security and community with us as an employer. We offer an occupational pension, salary change and the option of flexpension. You also get access to our benefits portal, where in addition to wellness allowance you have access to lots of discounts and offers in wellnes, home and leisure, transport, healthcare and much more! Your well-being is of the highest priority for us, and we therefore offer you as an employee Corporate Health Care to deal with all the challenges of everyday life, both at work and in private life

### **Salary**


As agreed.

### **Admission and Application**


Full time, office hours. Our client wishes to start immediately and the assignment is expected to run until 2024-12-31 with possibility of extension. You will be employed by JobBusters as a consultant with our exciting client. Send in your application in English (preferably in Word format) as soon as possible, as interviews take place continuously. Application deadline is 2024-07-30.

title: Fullstack Developer
description:
**Sambla Group is a fintech company with a clear goal – to make loans better for all. We need you, your ambition and your skills on our journey. We have become the fast-growing fintech company that we are today - bridging the gap between borrowers and lenders - thanks to all the 350+ amazing people who work here.**

**Our success is the result of the commitment to deliver the best customer journey and consumer finance products in the industry. Our vision is to democratize lending and empower customers to improve their personal finances. Through our well known brands such as Sambla, Advisa, Rahalaitos, Omalaina, Rahoitu and DigiFinans we support customers in consolidating and getting the best terms on their loans.**


We are seeking a skilled Full-Stack Developer with a strong emphasis on backend development to join our dynamic Self-Service team. This role focuses on maintaining and enhancing our customer journey, a key part of our customer-facing product.


Our primary language is JavaScript/TypeScript using NodeJS Express as our backend and React(JS/TS) as a frontend framework. We don’t expect you to be proficient on our stack, experience with other languages is welcome!

**Amongst other things, you will work with:**

* Maintain and develop our customer journey application.
* Collaborate on diverse projects, taking on various tasks and responsibilities within different codebases.
* Communicate rapidly and effectively within the team and across departments, including product, design, and data teams.
* Participate in daily code reviews to ensure high-quality code and continuous improvement.
* Work within an Agile inspired methodology, utilizing sprints, epics, and detailed ticket breakdowns.
* Value and incorporate team opinions regardless of seniority, fostering a collaborative environment.

**Must have:**

* Minimum of 3 years of working experience as a developer.
* Proficiency in English, both verbal and written.
* Strong communication skills and curiosity.
* Problem-solving mindset, both individually and collaboratively.
* Passion for sharing knowledge and ideas.

**A bit of extra credit if you also have:**

* Experience with Node.js.
* Experience with React.
* Backend development expertise.
* Docker experience.
* SQL knowledge.
* Experience with microservice architecture.
* Experience with AWS.
* Experience from the Fintech industry.

**What we offer:**

* A benefits package that includes health-related benefits, pension plans, paid time off, and additional perks designed to support your overall well-being and professional growth.
* Business in mind & people at heart – we deliver results together and celebrate our achievements.
* A varied and challenging role in a multinational and highly innovative company, where we value the development of our employees
* We are strong believers in creating a fun workplace where people enjoy coming to work.
* A friendly culture with openness and respect for one another, with the possibility to influence and make a difference on society and people’s everyday lives.  

  

Please note!
  

As part of our efforts to foster an unbiased recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to not include picture, gender, ethnicity, religion, disability, sexual orientation or age in your CV.

r du en senior .Netutvecklare och vill frndra och frbttra samhllet vi lever i? Hr fr du mjligheten. Just nu sker vi erfarna .Netutvecklare till vrt team inom offentlig sektor i Stockholm!

**vriga meriter fr tjnsten**  

Erfarenhet av ActiveMQ eller liknande meddelande/khanterare  

Erfarenhet av Elastic Search, Linux (bash) och att skriva enhetstester  

Erfarenhet av GitOps t.ex ArgoCD  

Kunskap och praktisk erfarenhet av DevOps, CI/CD-verktyg och pipelines, t.ex Tekton eller motsvarande  

Erfarenhet av teknikerna/verktygen, Jira, Confluence, bitbucket
  

  

Lter det intressant? Kul! Vi ser fram emot att hra ifrn dig! Skicka in din anskan redan i dag d urvalet sker lpande. Har du frgor om rollen, kontakta grna Peter Ravering, Director Consulting Services/ Konsultchef, p Peter.ravering@cgi.com .  

  

#LI-AR

Du r inbjuden att ta gandeskap redan frn frsta dagen i vrt arbete med att frverkliga vr drm om att skapa en arbetsmilj dr vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgngen fr vrt fretag. Det r drfr vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare n anstllda. Vi drar nytta av vr kollektiva framgng och tillsammans fr vi mjlighet att aktivt forma vr fretagsstrategi och inriktning.  

  

Ditt arbete skapar vrde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lsningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du fr tillgng till globala mjligheter att skala upp dina ider, omfamna nya mjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.

**Title** Systemutvecklare **Category** Software Development/ Engineering **City** Jnkping, Vstra Gtaland, Sweden **Job Description** Systemutvecklare
  

  

Job Description  

Nu sker vi ytterligare en systemutvecklare till vrt kontor i Jnkping. Har du en ambition att fortstta utvecklas? D ska du ska dig till oss i Jnkping!  

  

Vrt arbetsklimat prglas av en hjlpsam attityd, prestigels instllning och hgt i tak i en platt organisation. Du kommer att arbeta tillsammans med mycket kompetenta kollegor i spnnande uppdrag, och vi vgar lova inspirerande mten med stora utvecklingsmjligheter och bra kompetensutveckling. Vi som arbetar hr r drivna och motiverade. Att ha roligt p jobbet r ngot som r vldigt viktigt fr oss, och att ha en balans i livet r en sjlvklarhet.  

  

  

  

Your future duties and responsibilities  

Som systemutvecklare hos oss kommer du att arbeta i olika typer av projekt dr du fr stora mjligheter att utveckla dina intressen och kunskaper inom programmering och teknik. Uppdragen och dess utformning r varierande och beroende p kundens behov och den kompetens just du har.

Grna minst 3 rs erfarenhet i rollen som systemutvecklare, om du r mer senior r det mycket meriterande  

Kunskaper inom Java eller .Net/C#  

Ltt fr att uttrycka dig i svenska och engelska, bde i tal och skrift  

  

**Det r ocks meriterande om du har:**  

  

Erfarenhet av att delta i agila projekt  

Erfarenhet av frontend-utveckling  

  

r du den vi sker?  

  

Vi tror att du som person r en problemlsare och tycker att det r viktigt att ha roligt p jobbet tillsammans med ditt team! Vidare tror vi du r positiv och nyfiken, kan hantera olika typer av individer och situationer och att du r intresserad av att utveckla dig inom ditt omrde. Du har en frmga att alltid anpassa dig till din kunds verksamhet, arbetar stndigt fr kundens bsta och hller vad du lovar.  

  

Ngra av vra frmner  

Friskvrdsbidrag: Vi erbjuder ett rligt friskvrdsbidrag p 4 000 kr.  

Frldraln: Vi betalar upp till cirka 90% av din ln under den frsta tiden hemma.  

Trygg anstllning: Vra konsulter anstlls med kollektivavtal och frskringar.  

Pensionslsningar: Vi erbjuder attraktiva och frmnliga pensionslsningar.  

Personalbil: Personalbilen anvnds som en privatbil men leasas av CGI.  

Aktieprogram och delgarskap: Som delgare har du mjlighet att pverka och i vrt aktieprogram matchar CGI ditt bidrag, krona fr krona upp till 3% av din mnadsln.  

  

Och om det fortfarande finns ngot du undrar ver, skicka grna din frga till Andreas Andersson, Director Consulting Services, andreas.andersson@cgi.com  

  

  

  

**Sammen, som eiere, gjr vi meningsfull innsikt om til handlinger.**  

  

Livet i CGI er forankret i eierskap, samarbeid, respekt og tilhrighet. Her kan du n ditt fulle potensial fordi du inviteres til bli medeier fra dag n, samtidig som vi jobber for vr felles drm. Derfor kaller vi oss CGI-partnere i stedet for ansatte. Vi drar nytte av vr felles suksess, og har mulighet og ansvar for aktivt forme selskapets strategi og retning.  

  

Ditt arbeid skaper verdi. Du vil lage innovative lsninger og bygge relasjoner med kolleger og kunder, samtidig som du har tilgang til globale ressurser for utvikle ideene dine, se nye muligheter og dra nytte av CGIs omfattende bransje- og teknologiekspertise.  

  

Du vil forme din karriere ved bli med i et selskap som er bygget for vekst og varighet. Du vil bli stttet av ledere som bryr seg om din helse og velvre, og gir deg muligheter til utvikle dine ferdigheter og utvide dine horisonter.  

  

Bli med i vrt team en av verdens strste konsulenttjenestebedrifter innen IT og forretningsrdgivning.

* Java
* Angular

title: Developer
description:
Developer


Developers/Testers


* Highly skilled in SW design C-programming, and C++ programming on GPP.

radio access protocols.


* Experience with developing/systemizing/testing software for 5G L2/L3 protocols(vCU) and 5G L1/L2 protocols(vDU).

title: Full-Stack Developer
description:
Scania is currently undergoing an exciting transformation from a traditional truck manufacturer to a provider of complete sustainable transport solutions.
  
  

IT is a crucial part of this transformation as Scania’s success is depending on flexible and efficient IT solutions that support current and future business requirements.
  
  

Are you our new amazing Full-Stack Developer?
  
  

Then come and join one of the most exciting teams working with the latest technologies. We are looking for an additional team member to join our mission ensuring the safety for the driver and the vehicle by using the latest technologies. You will be part of our agile team that values collaboration and social interaction.
  
  

The Team and our responsibilities
  
We are a team of 6 competent members working very tight together in an agile environment, collaborating closely with other team members and departments. One of the advantages is that our system is still at the beginning of the life cycle which offers you flexibility, as part of our team you have the freedom to form and build solutions from scratch. Our application is business critical and there is a lot of focus on the quality of the code, useability, security and performance.
  
  

We value a positive work environment and prioritize having fun while getting things done!
  
  

What You Bring
  
In order to succeed in this role, you need to have solid proven experience and knowledge of the following:
  
* C#, .NET Core, ASP.NET, WebAPI, UnitTest
* OAuth
* Git
* GitLab for CI/CD (or similar platform)
* IaC and AWS (or similar platform)
* NoSQL
* Agile software development
* Monitoring/logging/observability strategies
* Distributed & Critical system projects


It is meritorious but not mandatory if you also have experience with
  
* DDD (domain driven design)
* Integration/Regression Tests
* Hashing Algorithms, Symmetric & Asymmetric keys


You have a degree in IT, Computer Sciences, Engineering, or equivalent experience, and are fluent in English.
  
  

You are a team player with a proactive, curious and solution oriented mindset. Furthermore you are service minded, hands-on and like to work in an international set-up.
  
  

You are focusing on common goals, have an open mindset, strong curiosity to learn new things, find new ways of solving problems and you know how to organize your own work to meet set targets. You appreciate continuous exchange of knowledge and seek constant improvement.
  
  

If you are interested and feel that you have a fair share of what is mentioned above, please apply! If you also have a GitHub/Lab, please send us the link. We would love to hear from you!
  
  

What We Offer
  
We offer an inspiring workplace, diverse, with great respect for the individual, where you have great opportunities to shape not only your work but also your future. Your personal and professional development is essential and something we encourage and support.
  
  

We are flexible with the workplace, with a hybrid approach, you work from home most of the week and we meet on Tuesdays in the office, as it is today. Of course we are flexible in case we need to meet other days at the office.
  
  

What’s in it more for you?
  
* An exciting and challenging international work environment
* The opportunity to develop your technical expertise and further your knowledge
* Colleagues who are eager to share their expertise
* We promote smart working, meaning you can easily combine your working life with your private situation to ensure a healthy work life balance
* A competitive remuneration package


In addition to career and development opportunities and flexibility, we can offer you other benefits such as free training at Scania's own health centre Gröndal, or a wellness allowance. You will also be offered performance bonuses, an occupational pension, flexible working hours, the opportunity to lease a car through the company, and much more. Scania also organizes several events throughout the year where family and friends are always welcome. If you live in Stockholm, we also offer a direct bus service between Stockholm and Södertälje with Scania Jobexpress.
  
  

We focus on you as a person, so come as you are. We mean it!
  
  

For additional information
  
In this recruitment Scania cooperates with eData Solutions AB. For questions about the position or the recruitment process, kindly contact Daniel Ruja at daniel@edata.se.
  
  

Time line and process
  
Applicants are advised to apply as soon as possible, but the latest on the August 18th, 2024. A background check might be conducted for this position. Please note that selection and interviews will be handled on an ongoing bases.
  
  

Kindly also note that different tests will be conducted, as part of recruitment process: personality test, as well as a code test regarding your competence.
  
  

For GDPR reasons, we kindly request that you only send applications through the system, as we do not accept other means.

**Job order - J0923-0062 - Permanent Full Time**
**Title** BI-utvecklare, Stockholm **Category** Analytics and Emerging Digital Technologies **City** Stockholm, Stockholm , Sweden **Job Description** BI-utvecklare, Stockholm
  

  

Beskrivning av tjnsten  

**Observera att fr den hr rollen behver du behrska svenska flytande i bde tal och skrift**  

  

r du intresserad av en roll inom Business Intelligence-omrdet dr du fr mjlighet att leverera i en komplex Data Warehouse-lsning? Vill du bli en del av ett av Sveriges hrligaste BI-team och samtidigt bli erbjuden en trygg anstllning dr du fr utvecklas? D r denna tjnst helt rtt fr dig!  

  

Vi utkar nu ett av vra team inom Data Warehouse med fler erfarna BI-utvecklare. Du kommer att ing i ett vxande team fr att hjlpa en av vra bankkunder med sina Data Warehouse-lsningar.  

  

  

  

Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter  

I den hr leveransen kommer du designa och implementera BI-lsningar med hjlp av SQL, SSIS och Cognos. En central del av rollen innebr att utveckla och underhlla dataflden och ETL-processer samt skapa och underhlla datamodeller och rapporteringslsningar. Du kommer ocks anvnda dig av SSAS (kuber).  

  

En viktig del av vrt tagande till kunden r att hantera och utveckla rapportering utifrn regulatoriska krav, till olika myndigheter. Vi ser det drfr som meriterande om du har erfarenhet av bank och/eller annan kunskap om finansiella instrument eller ekonomi.  

  

Du blir en del av vr BI-community, dr du fr chansen att bde hlla dig uppdaterad med de senaste trenderna och teknologierna inom Business Intelligence och att dela med dig av dina egna kunskaper. Vi erbjuder ven utbildning och support till kunder i BI-verktyg och teknologier.  

  

  

  

Kvalifikationer fr att bli framgngsrik denna roll  

Eftersom vra kunder och dokumentationen du kommer f arbeta med r p svenska, s r ett krav fr denna tjnst god kommunikationsfrmga i svenska, bde i tal och i skrift.  

  

Utver detta ser vi grna att du har:  

Minst 3 rs erfarenhet av rollen som BI-utvecklare  

Kunskap i SQL och erfarenhet av SSIS och Cognos  

Erfarenhet av datawarehousing och datamodellering  

  

D vra kunder primrt r inom bank och finans r det meriterande med erfarenhet frn banksektorn.  

  

Som person r du trygg i din yrkesroll, ansvarsfull och noggrann. Du r sjlvgende i ditt arbete och trivs bde med att arbeta individuellt och i team. Utver detta ser vi att du r en person som r nyfiken och initiativtagande nr det kommer till att lsa problem och du delar med dig av dina kunskaper och best practice.  

  

**Vill du veta mer?**  

Vad roligt! Kontakta d grna mig, Anna Osterman, som r rekryterande chef fr denna roll. Du nr mig p anna.osterman@cgi.com, 0761 01 31 13.  

  

Vi ser fram emot att hra frn dig! Anskningarna hanteras lpande, s skicka in din anskan redan i dag! Tilltrde sker enligt verenskommelse.  

  

**Vad kan vi p CGI erbjuda dig?**  

Vi r mer n du tror - Vi r ett globalt fretag dr det finns flera mjligheter n att vara konsult och dr work-life balance uppmuntras. Hos oss kan du jobba med vra egna produkter, Inhouse eller ute hos kund. Var du n befinner dig i livet finns det mjligheter fr dig p CGI. Det som gr oss unika r att vi lyckas vara bde globala och lokala p samma gng. Vi vljer att kalla det fr Glocal: Vad det faktiskt innebr r att det bsta ur tv vrldar kombineras. Det globala sammanhanget och stabiliteten finns, samtidigt som varje kontor bygger sin personliga kultur med trivsel och vlmende i fokus.
  

  

Som anstlld erbjuds du nedan frmner:  

Aktieprogram och delgarskap: Som delgare har du mjlighet att pverka och i vrt aktieprogram matchar CGI ditt bidrag, krona fr krona upp till 3% av din mnadsln  

Frldraln: Vi betalar ut minst 90% av din ln under den frsta tiden hemma  

Friskvrdsbidrag: Vi erbjuder ett rligt friskvrdsbidrag om 4 000 kr  

Trygg anstllning: Vra medlemmar anstlls med kollektivavtal och frskringar  

Pensionslsningar: Vi erbjuder attraktiva och frmnliga pensionslsningar  

Personalbil: Personalbilen anvnds som en privatbil men leasas av CGI  

  

Ls mer om CGI p vr hemsida: www.cgi.se  

  

#LI-AR  

  

  

  

**Lt oss som gare omvandla verklig insikt till handling tillsammans.**  

  

Livet p CGI bygger p gande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhrighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna n din fulla potential.  

  

Du r inbjuden att ta gandeskap redan frn frsta dagen i vrt arbete med att frverkliga vr drm om att skapa en arbetsmilj dr vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgngen fr vrt fretag. Det r drfr vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare n anstllda. Vi drar nytta av vr kollektiva framgng och tillsammans fr vi mjlighet att aktivt forma vr fretagsstrategi och inriktning.  

  

Ditt arbete skapar vrde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lsningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du fr tillgng till globala mjligheter att skala upp dina ider, omfamna nya mjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.  

  

Du kommer att forma din karrir tillsammans med ett fretag som r byggt fr att vxa och best. Du fr std av ledare som bryr sig om din hlsa och ditt vlbefinnande och ger dig mjligheter att frdjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.

* SQL

Som person delar du med dig av din kunskap, r dmjuk, ltt att samarbeta med och kan ha mnga bollar i luften samtidigt. CGI r det strsta konsultbolaget inom digitalisering och verksamhetsutveckling i Gteborg med en global organisation i ryggen.
  

  

Vr fretagskultur prglas av uppmuntran, samarbete och medmnsklighet. Det r hgt i tak och finns alltid utrymme fr att fnga upp och lyfta initiativ och nya ider. Fr att du ska trivas hos oss behver du vara en person som tar egna initiativ och ser det som sjlvklart att dela med dig av kunskap fr att f andra och ven dig sjlv att vxa och utvecklas.
  

  

Med vra gedigna kunskaper hjlper vi kunder inom svl privat som offentlig sektor med att mta deras utmaningar p bsta tnkbara stt. 90 000 medarbetare. I Sverige r vi ca 4000 anstllda p 30 orter med huvudkontor i Stockholm. Ls mer om CGI p vr hemsida: www.cgi.se

title: Identity Security Developer OpenText
description:
Are you a skilled developer/implementer with knowledge within OpenText/microfocus and ready for new exciting challenges? Are you searching for that little extra during your everyday life and want to be a key person of the market´s leading actor? If so, we are searching for you!!

  

With us you are a part of a team surrounded by experts in a forward leaning company with eyes set on the top. Because we are the best at IAM, Welcome home!

  

ID North offers products and services in the entire field of identity security (IAM, IGA, PAM), which is a central part of IT security. We are the leading company in Sweden and intend to further distance ourselves from the competition. We are on an exciting growth journey, which is why we are now looking for more solution developers who want to join our team and develop tomorrow’s identity security solutions for our customers.

 **Your mission**


As a Developer, you will implement advanced solutions based on the customer’s needs and requirements, such as secure login, integration for automatic account creation, and management of administrator rights. The assignments are technically exciting and challenging, and those who are passionate about developing technical breadth are in the right place. Working together in a project team with a project manager, solution architect, and solution developer, you will be involved in delivering top-notch identity security solutions within Project Delivery and/or Service Delivery Organization!


In your role, you will need to:

* Have an interest in configuring technically broad solutions in complex environments using market-leading products tailored to the customer’s needs.
* Be able to integrate systems for secure login and information flows for identities, accounts, and permissions.
* Work with customers and help them understand the solution being built.
* It is a merit to have worked with IAM, IGA, and/or PAM solutions.
* Knowledge of Active Directory/LDAP, Web Services, and standards such as SAML, OpenID Connect, OAuth2, SCIM is advantageous.
* It is also a merit to have knowledge and experience with Linux and Windows environments, MySQL and MSSQL databases, Java and Tomcat, Apache httpd, certificate management/SSL/TLS/PKI.
* Version control and release management with tools like Subversion or Git, as well as Ant or Maven, are advantageous.
* Experience with identity security products from SailPoint, MicroFocus/Opentext, Okta, Nexus, CyberArk, Microsoft.

  

There may be business trips in the role. We have offices in Stockholm, Borås, Gothenburg, Helsinki, and Copenhagen so your location can be flexible based on your needs.

 **Your competence**


We are looking for someone with an IT technical background. Experience and knowledge in identity security are highly valued. We prefer it if you have worked in teams/projects with customers and are unafraid to take on new technical challenges. Understanding of information flows, system integration, and basic programming skills are advantageous. You can communicate fluently in both Swedish and English, both spoken and written. You enjoy working in teams where implementation projects are motivating, and where teams work effectively and agile.

**Your qualities**


You enjoy working in teams with colleagues and customers, and you like to develop advanced technical solutions that require a broad technical understanding. We prefer that you are solution-oriented and interested in learning how to implement solutions with new products. We value your personal qualities and are looking for someone who is attentive, has good social skills, and is easy to collaborate with others. You find it extra motivating to share your knowledge with your colleagues.

 **We** **offer**


A strong and pleasant company at the forefront of our field, where our expertise and experience give us a competitive position. We offer development opportunities, and you will be surrounded by specialists! At ID North, you have good employment benefits, and you will become a key person for us. We enjoy each other’s company and take the opportunity to go on trips, adventures, and have fun on our journey to the top.


Does this sound like a position for you? We have an immediate need, so you should not hesitate to apply. Your application will be handled by Chief Human Resources Officer Linda Öhlin at linda.ohlin@id-north.com.


Welcome to your new career!

title: Software Engineer
description:
Want to be part of transforming road freight – for good? Einride is showing the world a new way to move, based on the latest digital, electric and autonomous technologies. Through freight capacity as a service, we enable businesses around the world to accelerate towards their sustainability goals.
   

  

 Founded in 2016, Einride became the first company in the world to deploy a cab-less autonomous electric vehicle on a public road (Sweden, 2019). In 2022, we were the first to successfully operate such a vehicle on a US public road. Today our award-winning technology has been launched across 8 countries (and counting). Our clients are some of the world’s biggest shippers, including Fortune 500 companies.
   

  

 We are looking for enthusiastic, humble and creative Software Engineers who are passionate about creating simple, beautiful and helpful solutions to empower the transport industry to go electric. As a Software Engineer at Einride, you will join one of our top talent teams where you will have the opportunity to innovate and drive change together with other ambitious, innovative and kind-hearted people who all challenge conventional thinking, think big, and aim for zero.
   

  

 You will be a part of building our full-stack solution for autonomous electric transport. You will join one of our exciting teams and functions that work on different aspects of our product. What team you will specialize in depends on your previous experience, knowledge and interests. This means that you can truly delve into a specific part of our product, such as:
   

  

* Control tower, enabling live remote operation to support the autonomous vehicle operations
* Autonomous vehicle data pipelines, serving state-of-the-art machine learning applications
* Autonomous vehicle software platform, building the foundation of the runtime and software platform, both in the vehicle and cloud
* Simulation, enabling fast development and safe deployments with state-of-the-art validation & verification environments


 What you'll do:
   

  

* Work across the whole tech stack, from vehicle to cloud, designing and building seamless, efficient and scalable solutions to challenging and complex problems
* Use the Go, Typescript, Rust programming languages on Linux, Google Cloud Platform and Github as your primary development “tools”


 What we're looking for:
   

  

* You have 3-5 years professional experience and you constantly push yourself to improve your skills and understand new concepts and domains
* Are curious and open-minded about technologies. Our engineers strive towards T-shapedness
* Able to work in a diverse team and collaborate with others
* Experience communicating and coordinating across teams
* Contribute to building the Einride culture, learning from fantastic colleagues, and sharing your knowledge and experience


 Bonus Skills:
   

  

* Experience building developer productivity tools with a high degree of product excellence


 This is a full-time position based in Stockholm or Gothenburg. We recommend that you submit your application as soon as possible since selection and interviews are held continually.
   

  

 At Einride, we are innovators, building solutions the world has never seen before – but urgently needs. That’s why we take action, and it’s why we are always eager to be challenged. We know that our best innovations come from having a diverse mix of people, including those of different experiences, career paths, and walks of life. By coming together and sharing our perspectives openly – by disagreeing, discussing, and committing – we deliver greater impact.

title: Frontend Developer - Stockholm - 40-60K SEK
description:
**Stockholm Frontend Engineer 40-60K SEK per month** 








 I am working with an innovative Stockholm based consultancy looking to take on an experienced front-end developer. They are working on exciting digital accessibility projects across Sweden and strive to be the best at what they do.
 







 The business is made up of around 20 full-time employees and all of them are working within technology – but they operate on a flat hierarchy, meaning you will always be involved in company and technology decisions, as well as being able to learn from the wealth of experience in the team.
 







**The Role** 








 You will be working on projects for clients ranging from very short term (1 week) to longer term projects (6 months). Based mainly remotely but some travel to client sites may be required. Projects will involve building platforms from scratch, also adding features etc to existing platforms.
 







**Requirements** 








 I am looking for someone with 3 years minimum working in a frontend development role and experience working with web content accessibility guidelines on recent projects.
 



  





 Experience working with React and willingness to use other frameworks.
 








 Nice to haves
 



* CPACC or WAS certifications







**Benefits** 



* Salary 40-60K SEK per month (dependent on experience)
* Profit share bonus paid annually











 If this sounds like something you would be interested in, please drop me an email on jack.taylor@amicusjobs.com

title: Software Engineer (Kafka/Github Actions)
description:
**Company Description**
 H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M here.
   

  

 This is a full-time position with placement in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

**Job Description**
 If taking H&M’s integration platform to its next level excites you, then this opportunity is for you! The Event and Integration Services team is looking for an experienced DevOps engineer with a strong focus on working with Kafka. In this role, you will engage with a diverse and innovative integration ecosystem, collaborating with a highly skilled team that maintains various central integration platforms at H&M. You will see the big picture, identify patterns, and instinctively know how to win support for your ideas. Partnering with different teams and areas, you will support our Unit in driving the Integration Platforms & Services mission and roadmap. You will build and configure Kafka solutions that are easy to maintain and adapt, regardless of tools or languages. Believing in a non-hierarchical culture of collaboration, transparency, safety, and trust, you will work with a focus on value creation, growth, and serving customers with full ownership and accountability. Join our high-performance team and constantly improve the experience of our end users.
   

  

 Some of your responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Strong experience in software engineering with focus on event streaming platforms such as Kafka and Solace.
* Worked with Event-driven Architecture and knowledge of how to implement this on a large scale in an Enterprise.
* Deep understanding of CI/CD automation for platform onboarding and self-service capabilities
* Deep knowledge of public cloud technologies (Azure & GCP primary)
* Strong agile mindset and skilled in planning, prioritizing, execution, and follow ups with cross functional teams.
* Develop and maintain event-driven architecture using platforms like Solace and Kafka.
* Ensure high quality of developed technical solutions
* Evaluate new platforms and features and work on proof of concepts and prototypes
* Deliver on time, demonstrating a strong commitment to deliver on the team mission and agreed backlog
* Create knowledge and produce the necessary documentation


**Qualifications**
* 10+ years of overall experience with 5+ years of experience working as a DevOps Engineer
* Deep understanding of Event-Driven Architecture principles.
* Substantial experience with version control software (Azure DevOps, Github etc.)
* Extensive hands-on experience with event platforms such as Solace and Kafka.
* Strong scripting skills (Powershell, Bash, or similar).
* Proficiency in scripting and automation using tools such as Terraform, Ansible, or similar.
* Extensive experience with the Microsoft Azure platform especially working with Azure storage, Event grid.
* Experience with a sprint-based agile way of working and knowledge of tools like Jira, confluence, ServiceNow
* Knowledge and experience working with performance testing methodologies and tools


**Additional Information**
**Working with tech at H&M Group**
 The fashion and retail industries are going through a transformation, driven by customers' technology and sustainability expectations. At H&M Group, we want to shape the future of fashion and lifestyle by harnessing the power of smart tech and data. With our 74-year history of innovation, we understand the need to collaborate and co-create with engineers and tech specialists around the world to achieve our vision.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 You are joining a unique value-driven culture, a large tech network and community where you can be yourself. Besides the obvious perks such as staff discount card, learning communities, wellness and parental benefits, there are a lot of opportunities to experiment and grow in the direction you want. Being a major player gives us countless opportunities to make a real impact and shape the future.
   

  

 H&M Group is committed to creating a diverse & inclusive environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, national origin, disability or age. Learn more about our I&D work https://youtu.be/veRbl9Cijts
   

  

 This is a full-time position based in Stockholm. Please apply as soon as possible but no later than 30th of July. We will review and interview applicants on-going. If you have questions, please contact Talent Acquisition Partner Hranda Khrystyna at khrystyna.hranda@hm.com

title: Web Developer
description:
Our mission is great open source
   

  

 It is our mission to make open source software available to people everywhere. We create world-renowned software, impacting the lives of millions of people every day.
   

  

 The web team works in a multi-disciplinary environment with visual designers, UX designers and other developers to bring exciting new web projects to life. We help and learn from each other and constantly strive to improve both our work and our processes.
   

  

**Required Skills And Experience**
* Demonstrable experience of work on modern web applications
* A strong understanding of HTML, CSS with SCSS and JavaScript
* Experience with Javascript components libraries
* Experience with TypeScript
* Experience with responsive user interfaces for a wide range of devices and browsers
* Experience with Git or other version control systems
* Awareness of SEO best practice
* Consideration of accessibility in all aspects of your work
* A strong understanding of web performance in complex user interfaces
* Ability to interact with UX, designers and server-side developers
* Curiosity about technology and a thirst to learn
* Based in EMEA timezones (Europe, the Middle East and Africa)
* University degree or equivalent education


 Useful experience if you have it
   

  

* Familiarity with Linux desktop technologies
* Server-side languages, such as Python or NodeJS
* Experience working on a large scale React (with TypeScript) project
* A history of open source contributions
* Relevant work experience


 Who you are
   

  

 We want a Web Developer who loves what they do. You are passionate about web standards and keep abreast of new developments in our industry. You always look for opportunities to improve your skills. You like to show off what you're working on and also learn from others. You have strong attention to detail and value the design of a product as much as you value the code. You have strong communication skills and maybe even blog once in a while. You're aware of the latest CSS techniques but also know the limitations that developing for a broad audience can bring - actually, you embrace the challenge.
   

  

 In this team
   

  

* You'll create high fidelity websites and web apps using the latest incarnations of HTML, CSS (SCSS) and Javascript (React and TypeScript)
* You'll help maintain existing projects including updating content and adding new pages
* You'll manage incoming requests for updates and liaise with or delegate to other people as necessary
* You'll ensure the standard of our output remains high and consistent across our whole product portfolio
* You'll ensure new pages are published according to specification and in compliance with our web style guide
* You'll participate in and contribute to our living style guide, Vanilla Framework.
* Work closely with UX designers and visual designers to implement exemplary user experiences.


 What we offer
   

  

* An opportunity to help shape a company and products with a strong influence in the open source community
* An inclusive work environment within a team of friendly people with a broad range of skill sets, from UX designers to copywriters
* Learning and development
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual leave
* Priority Pass for travel


*We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.*

title: Software Engineer
description:
Cloud innovations change the gaming industry landscape every day, adding new capabilities, allowing new scenarios, and redefining the category. Our mission is to provide a reliable, and easy way to develop and operate game servers. Within EA, the Game Server Hosting group builds the important game server infrastructure that underpins EA's current generation of multiplayer games and fuels development of the next wave. We are looking for a Software Engineer to join the team driving our game server platform forward and help ship EA's next amazing multiplayer game.
   

  

**What a Senior Software Engineer does on EA's Game Server Hosting team:**
 Reporting To The Director Of Engineering, Game Server Hosting, Your Primary Responsibility Will Be To Influence The Architecture And Design Of Our Containerized Software And Services Infrastructure, Then Guide The Delivery Of Those Designs. Most Of Your Time Will Be Spent Working With Your Teammates, Planning And Creating High-quality Services And Systems That Power And Support EA Games And Their Dedicated Game Servers. You Will Contribute To The Growth Of The Entire Team Through Active Participation Processes Such As Mentoring And Code Reviews, Promoting Best Practices Both Internally To The Team And Externally With Partners. Here Are Some Other Activities We Expect Of You
   

  

* Develop creative solutions that address customer requests, deliver new features and fix defects
* Collaborate with customers and product owners across teams and time zones to create designs that balance priorities and requirements and can be broken down into clear execution plans
* Develop well-tested code that follows peer-reviewed coding standards
* Guide the debugging of complex and hard to reproduce problems and contribute to post-mortems for unsuccessful releases
* Communicate, and enforce our quality processes, coding best practices
* Enhance EA's engineering capabilities through tracking of industry, segment, and technology transformations
* Support and mentor other team members through advice, coaching and educational opportunities and impart, design, and debugging skills to them


**The Next Great EA Software Engineer Needs To Have**
* 10+ years fullstack commercial development experience
* Expertise with one or more web development frameworks - React, Angular, VueJS
* Expertise developing RESTful web services or gRPC services at Internet consumer scale
* 3+ years hands-on domain experience in cloud operational infrastructure and services
* Experience working on high traffic services and scalable systems, multi-threaded design with a complete understanding of an OO language
* Experience working within one or more public cloud providers (AWS, Azure, GCP)
* Firsthand use of scaling technologies such as memcached, queuing
* First hand experience in all phases of a modern service development lifecycle, including requirement definition, architecture, technical development, debugging, testing, troubleshooting, product release, and live operation.


**Bonus Experience Points**
* Proficiency with Golang
* Experience with Kubernetes as an orchestration system for large numbers of workloads (1000+ pods in multiple regions)
* Familiarity with game engines and game software development processes
* Engineering Collaboration software - JIRA, GitLab, GitHub, or Confluence

title: Fullstack Developer
description:
**Sambla Group is a fintech company with a clear goal – to make loans better for all. We need you, your ambition and your skills on our journey. We have become the fast-growing fintech company that we are today - bridging the gap between borrowers and lenders - thanks to all the 350+ amazing people who work here.**
**Our success is the result of the commitment to deliver the best customer journey and consumer finance products in the industry. Our vision is to democratize lending and empower customers to improve their personal finances. Through our well known brands such as Sambla, Advisa, Rahalaitos, Omalaina, Rahoitu and DigiFinans we support customers in consolidating and getting the best terms on their loans.**
 We are seeking a skilled Full-Stack Developer with a strong emphasis on backend development to join our dynamic Self-Service team. This role focuses on maintaining and enhancing our customer journey, a key part of our customer-facing product.
   

  

 Our primary language is JavaScript/TypeScript using NodeJS Express as our backend and React(JS/TS) as a frontend framework. We don’t expect you to be proficient on our stack, experience with other languages is welcome!
   

  

**Amongst Other Things, You Will Work With**
* Maintain and develop our customer journey application.
* Collaborate on diverse projects, taking on various tasks and responsibilities within different codebases.
* Communicate rapidly and effectively within the team and across departments, including product, design, and data teams.
* Participate in daily code reviews to ensure high-quality code and continuous improvement.
* Work within an Agile inspired methodology, utilizing sprints, epics, and detailed ticket breakdowns.
* Value and incorporate team opinions regardless of seniority, fostering a collaborative environment.


**Must Have**
* Minimum of 3 years of working experience as a developer.
* Proficiency in English, both verbal and written.
* Strong communication skills and curiosity.
* Problem-solving mindset, both individually and collaboratively.
* Passion for sharing knowledge and ideas.


**A Bit Of Extra Credit If You Also Have**
* Experience with Node.js.
* Experience with React.
* Backend development expertise.
* Docker experience.
* SQL knowledge.
* Experience with microservice architecture.
* Experience with AWS.
* Experience from the Fintech industry.


**What We Offer**
* A benefits package that includes health-related benefits, pension plans, paid time off, and additional perks designed to support your overall well-being and professional growth.
* Business in mind & people at heart – we deliver results together and celebrate our achievements.
* A varied and challenging role in a multinational and highly innovative company, where we value the development of our employees
* We are strong believers in creating a fun workplace where people enjoy coming to work.
* A friendly culture with openness and respect for one another, with the possibility to influence and make a difference on society and people’s everyday lives.


 Please note!
   

  

 As part of our efforts to foster an unbiased recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to not include picture, gender, ethnicity, religion, disability, sexual orientation or age in your CV.
   

  

 Sambla Group is the new generation of brokers. Our ambition has always been the same - to challenge the banks’ offers so that our customers, regardless of the conditions, should always have the same opportunity to obtain the best possible loan solution. Sambla Group has grown to over 350 employees, established itself in Sweden, Norway, Finland and Denmark with offices in Sweden, Finland and Denmark.

title: Freelance Senior .NET Developer
description:
Freelance Senior .NET Developer
 



 1 year contract
 



 Hybrid (Stockholm)
 



  





 Vallum Associates is currently recruiting for one of their leading clients within the manufacturing space who is one of the fastest growing energy businesses in the Netherlands. They are looking for a Senior .NET Developer to help add a new feature to their online payments platform.
 



  





 Experience needed:
 



  




* 6 years experience in C#/.NET
* Develop and maintain RESTful APIs to expose microservices and other data sources to internal and external consumers.
* Work with the DevOps team to implement continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) for microservices, APIs, and full-stack web applications.



  





 This is a fantastic opportunity for a highly skilled Senior .NET Developer to work on cutting edge technology in the payments space.
 



  





 If you are a Senior .NET Developer and like the sound of this opportunity, please apply or email Joe Williamson directly on jwilliamson@vallumassociates.com.

title: Full-Stack Developer
description:
Scania is currently undergoing an exciting transformation from a traditional truck manufacturer to a provider of complete sustainable transport solutions. IT is a crucial part of this transformation as Scania’s success is depending on flexible and efficient IT solutions that support current and future business requirements.
   

  

**Are you our new amazing Full-Stack Developer?**
 Then come and join one of the most exciting teams working with the latest technologies. We are looking for an additional team member to join our mission ensuring the safety for the driver and the vehicle by using the latest technologies. You will be part of our agile team that values collaboration and social interaction.
   

  

**The Team And Our Responsibilities**
 We are a team of 6 competent members working very tight together in an agile environment, collaborating closely with other team members and departments. One of the advantages is that our system is still at the beginning of the life cycle which offers you flexibility, as part of our team you have the freedom to form and build solutions from scratch. Our application is business critical and there is a lot of focus on the quality of the code, useability, security and performance.
   

  

**We value a positive work environment and prioritize having fun while getting things done!**
**What You Bring**
 In order to succeed in this role, you need to have solid proven experience and knowledge of the following:
   

  

* C#, .NET Core, ASP.NET, WebAPI, UnitTest
* OAuth
* Git
* GitLab for CI/CD (or similar platform)
* IaC and AWS (or similar platform)
* NoSQL
* Agile software development
* Monitoring/logging/observability strategies
* Distributed & Critical system projects


 It is meritorious but not mandatory if you also have experience with
   

  

* DDD (domain driven design)
* Integration/Regression Tests
* Hashing Algorithms, Symmetric & Asymmetric keys


 You have a degree in IT, Computer Sciences, Engineering, or equivalent experience, and are fluent in English.
   

  

**You are a team player** 
 with a proactive, curious and solution oriented mindset. Furthermore you are service minded, hands-on and like to work in an international set-up.
   

  

**You are focusing on common goals** 
 , have an open mindset, strong curiosity to learn new things, find new ways of solving problems and you know how to organize your own work to meet set targets. You appreciate continuous exchange of knowledge and seek constant improvement.
   

  

**If you are interested and feel that you have a fair share of what is mentioned above, please apply! If you also have a GitHub/Lab, please send us the link. We would love to hear from you!**
**What We Offer**
 We offer an inspiring workplace, diverse, with great respect for the individual, where you have great opportunities to shape not only your work but also your future. Your personal and professional development is essential and something we encourage and support.
   

  

 We are flexible with the workplace, with a hybrid approach, you work from home most of the week and we meet on Tuesdays in the office, as it is today. Of course we are flexible in case we need to meet other days at the office.
   

  

**What’s in it more for you?**
* An exciting and challenging international work environment
* The opportunity to develop your technical expertise and further your knowledge
* Colleagues who are eager to share their expertise
* We promote smart working, meaning you can easily combine your working life with your private situation to ensure a healthy work life balance
* A competitive remuneration package


 In addition to career and development opportunities and flexibility, we can offer you other benefits such as
 **free training** 
 at Scania's own health centre Gröndal, or a wellness allowance. You will also be offered
 **performance bonuses, an occupational pension, flexible working hours, the opportunity to lease a car through the company, and much more.** 
 Scania also organizes
 **several events throughout the year where family and friends are always welcome** 
 . If you live in Stockholm, we also offer a direct bus service between Stockholm and Södertälje with Scania Jobexpress.
   

  

**We focus on you as a person, so come as you are. We mean it!**
**For Additional Information**
 In this recruitment Scania cooperates with
 **eData Solutions AB.** 
 For questions about the position or the recruitment process, kindly contact Daniel Ruja at daniel@edata.se.
   

  

**Time line and process**
 Applicants are advised to apply as soon as possible, but the latest on the
 **August 18th, 2024** 
 . A background check might be conducted for this position. Please note that selection and interviews will be handled on an ongoing bases.
   

  

 Kindly also note that different tests will be conducted, as part of recruitment process: personality test, as well as a code test regarding your competence.
   

  

 For GDPR reasons, we kindly request that you only send applications through the system, as we do not accept other means.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Södertälje | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2024/1 | Kontakt: Daniel Ruja, | Publicerat: 2024-07-23 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-08-18

title: Embedded Developer
description:
**Embedded C++ Developer** 




  





**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
 



 Contract position- Full-time
 



  





 Are you skilled in Embedded C++ with ARM and RTOS experience? Our client is looking for a talented individual to join our innovative technology team.
 



  





*Responsibilities:* 



* Develop and maintain embedded software using C++ for ARM microcontrollers.
* Implement real-time applications with high reliability and performance.

*Preferred:*

 Salary: 900 SEK P/H
